net.proteusframework.ui.workspace

Interface UITask

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractUITask

    public interface UITask
    User Interface Task. The class must implement equals(Object) and hashCode().
    Author:
    Russ Tennant (russ@proteus.co)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Component createTaskInformationComponent(LocaleContext localeContext)
      Create a component that displays a brief description of the task.
      Component createTaskUI(LocaleContext localeContext)
      Create the Task UI.

      Get optional actions associated with this task.

      Get a unique identifier that represents this task.

      Get the localization input locale.

      Get the label for the task.

      Get the label classname.

      Get the type of task.

      Get the type classname.
      Image getTypeIcon()
      Get the type icon.
      TextSource getTypeTooltip()
      Get the type of task tooltip.
      boolean supportsSerializaton()
      Return true or false if the UITask implementation supports serialization for the purpose of saving and restoring the user's task list.

    • Method Detail

      • createTaskInformationComponent

        Component createTaskInformationComponent(LocaleContext localeContext)
        Create a component that displays a brief description of the task. This is optional and can be null.
        Parameters:
        localeContext - the LocaleContext.
        Returns:
        the component or null.

      • createTaskUI

        Component createTaskUI(LocaleContext localeContext)
        Create the Task UI.
        Parameters:
        localeContext - the LocaleContext.
        Returns:
        the Task UI.

      • getActions

        java.util.List<Action> getActions()
        Get optional actions associated with this task. These may be displayed by the UITaskManager.

        It is recommended that Workspace and UITaskManager implementations call this after calling createTaskInformationComponent(LocaleContext) and createTaskUI(LocaleContext).

        Returns:
        optional list of actions. Return an empty list if not supported.

      • getIdentifier

        java.lang.String getIdentifier()
        Get a unique identifier that represents this task. The identifier must be consistent for the life of the instance.
        Returns:
        the identifier.

      • getInputLocale

        java.util.Locale getInputLocale()
        Get the localization input locale.
        Returns:
        the input locale. Never null.

      • getLabel

        TextSource getLabel()
        Get the label for the task.

        This may be called multiple times - in cases where the UITaskManager may think there is an opportunity for the task information to change.

        Returns:
        the label.

      • getLabelClassname

        java.lang.String getLabelClassname()
        Get the label classname.

        This may be called multiple times - in cases where the UITaskManager may think there is an opportunity for the task information to change.

        Returns:
        the label classname. May be null.

      • getLabelTooltip

        @Nullable
TextSource getLabelTooltip()
        Get the label tooltip for the task.

        This may be called multiple times - in cases where the UITaskManager may think there is an opportunity for the task information to change.

        Returns:
        the label tooltip. May be null.

      • getType

        @Nullable
TextSource getType()
        Get the type of task.
        Returns:
        the type of task. May be null.

      • getTypeClassname

        java.lang.String getTypeClassname()
        Get the type classname.
        Returns:
        the type classname. May be null.

      • getTypeIcon

        Image getTypeIcon()
        Get the type icon.
        Returns:
        the type icon.

      • getTypeTooltip

        @Nullable
TextSource getTypeTooltip()
        Get the type of task tooltip.
        Returns:
        the type of task tooltip. May be null.

      • supportsSerializaton

        boolean supportsSerializaton()
        Return true or false if the UITask implementation supports serialization for the purpose of saving and restoring the user's task list.
        Returns:
        true or false. If true, the implementation must implement Serializable or Externalizable.
